data.title: Crowded Sunday
data.text: We stopped in on an early Sunday afternoon.  Combination college/family/sports bar. Typical bar food with a few specials. Not my first choice, but the service was good, the food what's expected,and the prices reasonable.  We'd go back again.

data.title: Plays nice live music on the weekends
data.text: Great food as well.  But I really like the people that they get there to play music on the weekends.  It is nice to hang out.

data.title: Brilliant service, place and food
data.text:
We stumbled upon this place by accident as the diner next door was shut and we were so glad!

We were served by a lovely girl called Jordan who was friendly and efficient. The menu had a great variety to choose from and when it all came it was absolutely lovely and good value for money.

It's a nice sized bar with televisions and advertises live music on Friday and Saturday nights, also has different deals each night on drinks.

Would definitely recommend.

data.title: Great hang out in The District.
data.text: Good place to meet with friends. Food was good. Local brews on tap. However, the place is pretty noisy and it wasn't even that crowded when I was there. The had a "Ghost Burger" special. The implication being that ghost peppers were involved. However, the heat was around the jalapeno level. Still, the taste was good.

data.title: Nice place for lunch
data.text: The prices are quite reasonable and all 8 of us found something that everyone enjoyed. While Shiloh won't be confused for fine dining, that is perfectly ok: they have great burgers and the pizza is surprisingly good for a non-pizza place. The crust is remarkably good. Salads are "ok" - that seemed to be the primary weak spot. I have been one other time on a Sunday and the pizzas are really cheap all day.  Overall, good service and nice food - check it out.

data.title: Fine bar, GREAT patio
data.text: We usually go for burgers on Sunday ($4 for a burger and fries). They have plenty of TVs for sports and also a beautiful big patio where you can sit and eat. The food is pretty good for bar food but we really just like that it is never absolutely packed with undergrads and has an awesome patio.

data.title: OK - but better eateries within walking distance
data.text: We spent three days in the Columbia area and this was our least favorite restaurant.  This is a noisy college sports bar with limited draft beers.  Our waitress encouraged the daily special only to tell us later that the price was higher than she quoted.  Food was average; our waitress was more attentive to the younger patrons rather than us retired folks.  It's a nicely decorated establishment, but the hard floors and walls creates a noisy environment.

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: We were paasing through on the way to St Louis last Friday and two of us had the fish strips and fries and I had the crawfish poor boy with fries.  We stoped because it rated well on trip advisor and weren't disappointed.

data.title: Good Burger!!
data.text: In town for a basketball game, Great place fun atmosphere, very friendly staff. Everyone in my party love they food. Fair selection of beer.

data.title: Yummy Burgers!
data.text: It is usually pretty crowded, but the service here is better than other local places. The food is good and there are lots of TVs to catch your favorite game!

data.title: Gotta try the fried dill pickle chips!!
data.text: This was my first time to visit Shiloh Bar and Grill,  my sons are in college at Mizzou and one of them had recommended we try it.  There were 6 of us in our group and we all ordered something different and loved everything.  They have a wonderful selection of beer on tap, which we also tried. We had excellent service, maybe because we were eating early in the evening, but the wait staff was great.  Lots of TV's to watch any game you want.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Columbians and MU students love the inside and outdoor fun of this place.  Want a jello shot, so much fun!

data.title: Horrible service
data.text: Bartenders are slow and incompetent. The man working the door who may have been the owner thinks he was slick short changing customers when they paid a cover charge. I gave him a $20 to pay for 2 people. The cover was $5 per and he hands me $9 back. He knew what he was doing. This is a college bar so he probably does this often praying on under age kids. Drinks were over priced. However the band that was playing was good.

data.title: No games = fast service
data.text:
Traveling through on a marathon road trip, we were looking for anything that wasn't a chain fast-food place. Easy access from I70 and menu variety were high on our list. Shiloh's delivered.

There was no big game on TV, so the place was empty. We had fast, friendly service. The food was good, but not spectacular. 

This looks like a great game day experience, with plenty of TVs and space for standing around tables.

data.title: Great For a Large Party
data.text: Shiloh's is perfect for large groups and accommodated us very well.  The food is pretty average, but probably consistent.  I had no complaints, as I enjoyed my BLT.  I just wished that it did not have a third slice of bread like a club sandwich.  The fried pickles were enjoyed by all, but they were probably a frozen item.  We were able to spread out at our table and visit very well.  Our waitress was friendly and very capable.  The televisions were easy to spot, showing different football games, for those wishing to view the sport.  I would recommend this establishment to all, as it is comfortable and casual.

data.title: great food, great service
data.text: Tenderloin was huge and good seasoning. souse had 2.00 hamburger last night and 1.00 fries for tuesday night special! was super good and the service was top notch! only suggestion is to have the servers cover their thighs a lil bit as they are very young girls!

data.title: College kids are not smart enough to know better!!!!
data.text: Waitress was new and untrained!  Food was over priced and not appetizing!  Ordered four shiner bocks and it cost me more than what a twelve pack would have cost at the local store!  Nice bar....NOT!

data.title: Shilo catered our happy hour
data.text: Shilo catered our happy hour Friday.  We had Pulled Pork, Beef Brisket, Coleslaw, and Calico Baked Beans.  It was all delicious but especially the Calico Baked Beans, everyone wanted the recipe.  This is our second time using them for an event and we will definitely have them cater for us again.  We also enjoy eating at the restaurant.

data.title: Ribs & Specials
data.text: Ribs are some of best ever had. Dry rub. No need for BBQ Sauce. Great specials most every day/night. Burgers & calico beans are great.

data.title: Great Sidetrip off the Katy Trail
data.text:
If you decide to eat off of the usual Katy Trail spots, this is a good choice and it's close to the MKT spur. The atmosphere was casual and pleasant, the sandwiches were great. I had the Hawaiian chicken sandwich, it was the best sandwich of this type that I've ever had. Grilled chicken, ham, pineapple and Thai sweet sauce made a great combination. There were a lot of choices on the menu, they all looked good.

Warning, if you make this side trip the spur is crushed gravel like the Katy, 8.8 miles long and the trail is mostly uphill. The trip back down, of course, is much easier and quicker. You;ll be ready for a good lunch and a cold one when you get there, and you won't be disappointed with the food.
